column4: Can someone please help me, my /boot seems to have been completely erased
Are you sure it's mounted?
yes, it's mounted, and I can see the files in there, but there is no grub directory
Oh.  That's not quite so complete as I imagined, but it is quite odd.
Were you doing anything in there that might have caused it?
yea, I know I updated to the lates .15 kernel but when I rebooted it had removed everything from menu.lst so I think it did an imcomplete install of the new kernel or something
hrm..
and the menu.lst~ was the same

Ah.  I'd recommend backing up the menu.lst~, then copying it to menu.lst, then: Boot off of an older kernel, remove the latest kernel (you can check what your most recent is in synaptic), and then reinstall your latest kernel.
let me re-phrase that. Both menu.lst and menu.lst~ are the same, as in blank
ah.
Run "sudo update-grub" from the command line.
but it's a moot point now either way because the grub directory is no longer there so there is no grub whatsoever in stalled
I think that worked
wait...wait...no it didn't
there is still no /grub in there
but I'm going to reboot anyway and see what happens because I do see some things in there that might work
hrm.
